intro: Eriotheca globosa, commonly known as the globular eriotheca, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its spherical, woody fruit that resembles a small, rounded ball. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically small, simple, and革质 (leathery) in texture. Eriotheca globosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
